bioghist.p: (Herman) Theodore Dreiser (1871-1945) was born in 1871 in Terre Haute, Indiana. He was a journalist and a novelist. His works include Sister Carrie, An American Tragedy, Jennie Gerhardt, The Genius, and The Titan. He was an editor for several magazines, including Ev'ry Month, Delineator, and The American. Spectator.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of memorabilia from the family of Theodore Dreiser. Materials include watercolors, etchings, woodcuts, and a lithograph; framed photographic portraits, likely of Dreiser family members; neckties, handkerchiefs belonging to Theodore Dreiser; two plaster casts of Dreiser's hands and a plaster bust the author; a latex death mask of Dreiser; and other household artifacts, including a silver tray, a wine glass, a bronze sculpture, and several Buddha statuettes. The collection also includes a 1932 copy of the German magazine Simplicissimus

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
